    • Uses of Policy in burlap.behavior.policy

      Subinterfaces of Policy in burlap.behavior.policy 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  EnumerablePolicy
      An interface extension to Policy for policies that can enumerate their probability distribution over all actions.
      interface  SolverDerivedPolicy
      An interface for defining policies that refer to a MDPSolverInterface objects to defined the policy.
      Classes in burlap.behavior.policy that implement Policy 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  BoltzmannQPolicy
      This class implements a Boltzmann policy where the the Q-values represent the components of the Boltzmann distribution.
      class  CachedPolicy
      This class can be used to lazily cache the policy of a source policy.
      class  EpsilonGreedy
      This class defines a an epsilon-greedy policy over Q-values and requires a QComputable valueFunction to be specified.
      class  GreedyDeterministicQPolicy
      A greedy policy that breaks ties by choosing the first action with the maximum value.
      class  GreedyQPolicy
      A greedy policy that breaks ties by randomly choosing an action amongst the tied actions.
      class  RandomPolicy
      A uniform random policy for single agent domains.
      Methods in burlap.behavior.policy with parameters of type Policy 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static List<ActionProb> PolicyUtils.deterministicPolicyDistribution(Policy p, State s)
      A helper method for defining deterministic policies.
      protected static void PolicyUtils.followAndRecordPolicy(Policy p, Environment env, Episode ea)
      Follows this policy for one time step in the provided Environment and records the interaction in the provided Episode object.
      static Episode PolicyUtils.rollout(Policy p, Environment env)
      Follows the policy in the given Environment.
      static Episode PolicyUtils.rollout(Policy p, Environment env, int numSteps)
      Follows the policy in the given Environment.
      static Episode PolicyUtils.rollout(Policy p, State s, SampleModel model)
      This method will return the an episode that results from following the given policy from state s.
      static Episode PolicyUtils.rollout(Policy p, State s, SampleModel model, int maxSteps)
      This method will return the an episode that results from following the given policy from state s.

    • Uses of Policy in burlap.behavior.singleagent.learning.tdmethods.vfa

      Fields in burlap.behavior.singleagent.learning.tdmethods.vfa declared as Policy 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Policy GradientDescentSarsaLam.learningPolicy
      The learning policy to use.
      protected Policy ApproximateQLearning.learningPolicy
      The learners policy to use.
      Methods in burlap.behavior.singleagent.learning.tdmethods.vfa with parameters of type Policy 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void GradientDescentSarsaLam.GDSLInit(SADomain domain, double gamma, DifferentiableStateActionValue vfa, double learningRate, Policy learningPolicy, int maxEpisodeSize, double lambda)
      Initializes SARSA(\lambda) By default the agent will only save the last learning episode and a call to the GradientDescentSarsaLam.planFromState(State) method will cause the valueFunction to use only one episode for planning; this should probably be changed to a much larger value if you plan on using this algorithm as a planning algorithm.
      void GradientDescentSarsaLam.setLearningPolicy(Policy p)
      Sets which policy this agent should use for learning.
      void ApproximateQLearning.setLearningPolicy(Policy p)
      Sets which policy this agent should use for learners.
      Constructors in burlap.behavior.singleagent.learning.tdmethods.vfa with parameters of type Policy 
      Constructor and Description
      GradientDescentSarsaLam(SADomain domain, double gamma, DifferentiableStateActionValue vfa, double learningRate, Policy learningPolicy, int maxEpisodeSize, double lambda)
      Initializes SARSA(\lambda) By default the agent will only save the last learning episode and a call to the GradientDescentSarsaLam.planFromState(State) method will cause the valueFunction to use only one episode for planning; this should probably be changed to a much larger value if you plan on using this algorithm as a planning algorithm.

    • Uses of Policy in burlap.behavior.singleagent.planning

    • Uses of Policy in burlap.behavior.singleagent.planning.deterministic

      Classes in burlap.behavior.singleagent.planning.deterministic that implement Policy 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  DDPlannerPolicy
      This is a dynamic deterministic valueFunction policy, which means if the source deterministic valueFunction has not already computed and cached the plan for a query state, then this policy will first compute a plan using the valueFunction and then return the answer
      class  SDPlannerPolicy
      This is a static deterministic valueFunction policy, which means if the source deterministic valueFunction has not already computed and cached the plan for a query state, then this policy is undefined for that state and will cause the policy to throw a corresponding PolicyUndefinedException exception object.

    • Uses of Policy in burlap.behavior.singleagent.planning.stochastic.montecarlo.uct

    • Uses of Policy in burlap.behavior.stochasticgames

      Classes in burlap.behavior.stochasticgames that implement Policy 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  JointPolicy
      An abstract Policy object for defining a stochastic games joint policy; that is, a policy over joint actions taken by all agents in the world.
      class  PolicyFromJointPolicy
      This class defines a single agent's policy that is derived from a joint policy.

    • Uses of Policy in burlap.behavior.stochasticgames.madynamicprogramming

      Classes in burlap.behavior.stochasticgames.madynamicprogramming that implement Policy 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  MAQSourcePolicy
      An abstract extension of the JointPolicy class that adds a required interface of being able to a MultiAgentQSourceProvider.

    • Uses of Policy in burlap.behavior.stochasticgames.madynamicprogramming.policies

      Classes in burlap.behavior.stochasticgames.madynamicprogramming.policies that implement Policy 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  ECorrelatedQJointPolicy
      A joint policy that computes the correlated equilibrium using the Q-values of the agents as input and then either follows that policy or returns a random action with probability epsilon.
      class  EGreedyJointPolicy
      An epsilon greedy joint policy, in which the joint action with the highest Q-value for a given target agent is returned a 1-epsilon fraction of the time, and a random joint action an epsilon fraction of the time.
      class  EGreedyMaxWellfare
      An epsilon greedy joint policy, in which the joint aciton with the highest aggregate Q-values for each agent is returned a 1-epsilon fraction of the time and a random joint action an epsilon fraction of the time.
      class  EMinMaxPolicy
      Class for following a minmax joint policy.

    • Uses of Policy in burlap.domain.singleagent.gridworld
